availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Walker Hendrick (Warren County, Kentucky, county surveyor and farmer)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, county surveyor and farmer. Warren County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary E. Graham Walker in Warren County, Kentucky, on February 11, 1851. Father of Samuel E. Hendrick, Joseph A. Hendrick, Ann E. Hendrick, Sarah C. Hendrick, James A. Hendrick, Forest Hendrick, and Henry L. Hendrick. County surveyor in Warren County in 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 851.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Lucus, p. 231A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000339890, p. 115.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Warren County, KY, February 1864, p. 63.
"Robert Walker Hendrick (1824-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #121576570, accessed September 7, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/121576570.
